body: Thanks @kl0u for the review. I've updated the PR. Could you have another look?
@zentol Thanks for your explanation. I will address your comments and rebase to the master. PS: I find the `flink-examples-streaming-kafka-0.11` module which merged just now also should be fixed.
cc @tillrohrmann
cc @fhueske @twalthr @pnowojski

I agree that configuring custom processing time provider on the API side is more robust approach for tests. The change might be a bit more involving. I have created issues to consider it: FLINK-10830, FLINK-10831.

One more option is to check if `currentTimeMillis` jumped back in `TtlVerifyUpdateFunction.performUpdate` relatively to the latest consumed value. If jump happened then just wait until `currentTimeMillis` returns the next value greater than the latest consumed value. This way the update never needs to be rejected for this reason and test restarted.

There is still potential subtle problem (could be not really practical) if:
- `timestampBeforeUpdate` gets increased value
- Flink gets jumped back `currentTimeMillis`
- lag happens and
- `timestampAfterUpdate` gets again increased value.

In this case, the time queried by Flink is completely out of test control and without plugging the time there is no way to sync it in Flink and test.
@azagrebin I commented on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-10830 about my concerns of allowing the user to specify his/her own processing time provider.
@zentol Have updated and rebased to the master. Would be great if you can take a look.

Actually, now @StefanRRichter mentioned it, we have the `TtlTimeProvider` and the `ProcessingTimeService`. Both of them are used internally by Flink to let it know what is the "current" processing time, but each of them has its own implementation (which happens to be `currentTimeMillis` for both). 

I think that these two should be unified and the `TtlTimeProvider` should call the `ProcessingTimeService::getCurrentProcessingTime()`. This will allow to have a "single point of truth".

What do you think @StefanRRichter and @azagrebin

@yanghua Please don't ping people again and again. You already pinged me 4 times here. Usually, all committers have a personal priority list for reviews. For example, this PR needs to be aligned with the [unified connector improvements](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Yaxp1UJUFW-peGLt8EIidwKIZEWrrA-pznWLuvaH39Y/edit#heading=h.41fd6rs7b3cf). I know we are slow sometimes, but we haven't forgotten you.
cc @pnowojski
As of right now no test is calling this method, I'd rather just inline this method into `test-runner-common.sh` so it's no longer accessible to tests.
cc @pnowojski
@zentol updated
@zentol Can you give a final check about this PR? thanks.

You may want to increase the network timeout like we did for the high-parallelism iterations test. https://github.com/apache/flink/commit/ecd4567bcf5403f26c46d212d6e1698b3eeadbfb

Jobs that take too long time (25+ seconds) to fully deploy may fail otherwise.

Related test-failure:
```
testDuplicate(org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.PojoSubclassSerializerTest)  Time elapsed: 0.101 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Concurrent access to KryoSerializer. Thread 1: Thread-240 , Thread 2: Thread-241
	at org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.kryo.KryoSerializer.enterExclusiveThread(KryoSerializer.java:623)
	at org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.kryo.KryoSerializer.copy(KryoSerializer.java:211)
	at org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.PojoSerializer.copy(PojoSerializer.java:256)
	at org.apache.flink.api.common.typeutils.SerializerTestBase$SerializerRunner.run(SerializerTestBase.java:597)
```
Thanks, the failure is great because we probably caught another offender.

@pnowojski Currently Travis is passed, I see that you have merged the fix for elasticsearch, I will merge your fix and verify it again.

You can also check if there are other places that need to be modified, I will fix it together.
Codes LGTM. Since RebalancePartitioner and RoundRobinPartitioner are duplicate right now, I would vote for keeping RoundRobinPartitioner whose name is more intuitive.
@zentol Can you take another look? I included the fix for the serializer in as a seperate issue/commit to this PR.

Update: The loop changes are causing some test failures. Please open a separate JIRA as this is probably a larger issue.

Can we cut the loop changes out of this PR without breaking the test?
Thanks for the reminder @yanghua. I'm still busy with the 1.7 release. Once it is out, I'll take a look at this PR.

Thank @zhijiangW and @tillrohrmann for reviews!

To @zhijiangW sorry for response too late to catch the discussion. I copy the description from the former commit, and since I am not an expert of English and this thread closed, you can open another thread if you think there is something misleading in the doc. Again sorry for the late response.
sorry, Complex Event Processing (CEP) SQL Realization this commit I can't remove
cc @zentol
I reverted the loop changes and factored out them into another PR #7073 for new issue [FLINK-10842](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-10842).

@twalthr Could you please take a look again on that PR?
Thank you
@pnowojski , thanks for reviews and suggestions. I will copy the description to the commit next time!
Hi. Did you check this PR?

Thanks for reviews, @Clarkkkkk @pnowojski . 
I have updated the codes for addressing the above comments!
Thanks @pnowojski. I will address your comments and merge this.
Hi @jihyun ! Currently we are busy with testing the release candidate for Flink-1.7. Unfortunately, this PR will have to wait until the release happens.
Thanks @StefanRRichter I will address @zentol comments and merge this to unblock #7045.
BTW the Travis build you link to has failed.
I bumped the version in all places and also added an exclude for the new `io.airlift.log-manager` dependency`. PTAL.
Hi @kl0u , maybe could you share your ticket regarding the implementation of logic to support supportsResume() method?
@pnowojski  Hi, would be great if you can take a look when you are free. Thank you.

@tillrohrmann I addressed the comments, please have another look. I think the duplicate code is correct as it was because `registeredSerializers` etc is handled in the constructor that was use to duplicate.
Comments addressed.

@StefanRRichter I only have one final comment about the while loop.
Other than that, this LGTM
I have fixed a subset of the review comments and rebased against the current master.

From the review comments a few points remain open for me:
Both are about the way the 'testing' code is part of the code base:
- The stopping of the Source (Bound being a separate Source)
- The connection to the local PubSub emulator (hostAndPort).

How do we proceed on these points?
@pnowojski I agree with you. Indeed, we can separate it. And splitting seems to be mostly targeted at shell scripts.
cc @pnowojski

@pnowojski I saw one step of this test case is `echo "Executing SQL: Match recognize -> Elasticsearch"` which contains both kafka source table and elasticsearch sink. It seems that there is still the need for integration testing of multiple versions of Kafka connector and eleasticsearch
Thanks @tillrohrmann! Merging.

hi @deepakmarathe,
do you have time to add the requested test ?
If not, i can do it, because I spend some time to find out why after calling getExecutionPlan(), i could not execute my job, while knowing with StreamingExecutionEnvironment it works !
Thanks for the review @tzulitai! Merging.
Thanks @tillrohrmann! Merging.

Hi @art4ul ! There is already an open PR for that issue and it is this one:
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/7047
you can also review it if you want so that it can get merged faster. From the name of the PR you can also find the issue number.

@twalthr What do you think of @pnowojski  s advice? At first I thought it was reasonable, but later I found out that there is a test scenario that uses both the kafka connector (source) and the elasticsearch connector (sink). I think it makes sense to keep this test scenario.

@yanghua I agree with @pnowojski. We should test Kafka and Elastic but we don't need to test them together. The `Executing SQL: Match recognize -> Elasticsearch` test was meant for testing the new `MATCH_RECOGNIZE` it must not use Elasticsearch or Kafka. I guess the reason why Kafka was chosen is because it is the only supported way of having time attributes in the SQL Client so far.

I think we should split the current SQL client test into a Kafka 0.10 test and a main SQL Client test (that always uses the most recent Kafka version, ES version etc.). This means we don't have a test regression but don't test everything for every connector version.

In this case in the end we need 3 test files:
1. Kafka tests in separate files (for 0.10 and 2.0).
2. Main SQL client tests with `Executing SQL: Match recognize -> Elasticsearch`, as @twalthr said it can currently depend on the most recent Kafka. However ideally it shouldn't have a connector dependencies, or at least to have as few of them as possible (and connectors should be tested independently, but that is an independent issue)
@twalthr @pnowojski  Thank you for your suggestion. It seems that I also misunderstood the original meaning of @pnowojski . I will refactor it as soon as possible.
The test passed in the linked build. The second build encountered a timeout since the cache hat do be rebuilt, the first failed in a subsequent bash e2e test.
Thanks for the review. I will wait for green travis.
@pnowojski Can you quickly take a look at whether the latest changes meet your requirements?
cc @pnowojski
Thanks for the update @yanghua. A first look at the changes looked good to me. I will take care of merging this.
Nice test, LGTM

I have reorganized commits to facilitate merging. This change has been validated on my own Travis (misc is out of time, but it doesn't seem to be caused by this PR). Of course, we should wait and see the results of Travis corresponding to Apache Flink.
Thanks for the review @tillrohrmann! Merging.

@tillrohrmann 

> shouldn't we close the partitionDiscoverer in the open method in case of a failure. Moreover, we could also close it there in the case if automatic partition discovery is disabled. 

right now, the if-else check of partition discovery is done in `run` method to decide if we need to close the `partitionDiscoverer` before `runFetchLoop`. I didn't want to change that, unless we want to move the starting of `discoveryLoopThread` into open method as well. is that what you have in mind?

I was thinking `cancel` method as the catch/finally block in Java. Plus it was the place where we close `partitionDiscoverer` for the enabled case. I though it might makes sense to ensure the cleanup in `cancel` method for both disabled and enabled cases

> in line FlinkKafkaConsumerBase.java:721 fails with an exception? 

line 721 is for the partition discovery enabled case, `partitionDiscoverer` is closed in the `cancel` method in line 748

@aljoscha 

Please help review it, thanks.
Any update on this PR?
I have created a new issue FLINK-10872 to provide end-to-end sql client test for kafka connector 0.11. Once this PR is merged, I will start the issue as soon as possible.
@tillrohrmann do you think it is ok to backport #7005? The `ClassLoaderUtils` were introduced in that PR that I am using in #7082. Changes in #7005 are somewhat related anyway.
cc @tillrohrmann

I check why the build failed and all I could find is this:

    [FAIL] 'Kafka 0.10 end-to-end test' failed after 0 minutes and 54 seconds! Test exited with exit code 0 but the logs contained errors, exceptions or non-empty .out files

I have been unable to find out why this happens and what our changes did to cause this.
Please advise.
Thanks for the review @twalthr. Merging this PR.
Please rebase the branch, e2e test runs are still failing but this is likely just caused by the recent instabilities in general.

> Also it is worth adding a line in the README for the Prometheus and this test that states that you can run them locally with mvn clean verify -De2e-metrics -DdistDir=YOUR_DIR

I don't really want to add these instructions right now since they are quite disconnected from the actual test. How the profile is called is determined in the pom, what the distDir property is called in the `FlinkDistribution`. I'd like to avoid them becoming out-dated, i.e. simply wrong.

I have some ideas on how to better document how to run them, so that if the test is not executed you get a message saying what was missing. E.g. "Test was skipped since property 'e2e-metrics' was not specified."
This way you would simply _try_ running them and get the infos on how to do it right there.
Thanks @zentol. I will remove the kubernetes test and merge this. Once Travis gives green light.
The changes have been applied to `cron-master-e2e` and `cron-1.7-e2e`.

Does it mean that those tests will always fail on user's travis(unless they setup AWS credentials)?
If so I think we should at least skip those tests if credentials are not provided?
@azagrebin Please have another look and let me know what you think!
btw, for verifying this change we can push it to a separate branch in the apache repo.

Thanks for the reviews.

The migration of credentials is not yet complete. End-to-end tests are missing and the Yarn ITCase as well.
The old credentials still work, will be phased out once we migrated everything.

+1 to adding a test utility to capture access to the env variables and the path construction.
Will add a commit here that refactors that.

Got the evidence that it is thread safety problem

```
2018-11-15 04:24:17,795 ERROR org.apache.flink.streaming.connectors.kafka.FlinkKafkaConsumerBase  - failed to close partitionDiscoverer
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: KafkaConsumer is not safe for multi-threaded access
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.acquire(KafkaConsumer.java:1627)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.close(KafkaConsumer.java:1526)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.close(KafkaConsumer.java:1506)
	at org.apache.flink.streaming.connectors.kafka.internal.Kafka09PartitionDiscoverer.closeConnections(Kafka09PartitionDiscoverer.java:97)
	at org.apache.flink.streaming.connectors.kafka.internals.AbstractPartitionDiscoverer.close(AbstractPartitionDiscoverer.java:101)
	at org.apache.flink.streaming.connectors.kafka.FlinkKafkaConsumerBase.cancel(FlinkKafkaConsumerBase.java:673)
	at org.apache.flink.streaming.api.operators.StreamSource.cancel(StreamSource.java:108)
	at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.SourceStreamTask.cancelTask(SourceStreamTask.java:100)
	at org.apache.flink.streaming.runtime.tasks.StreamTask.cancel(StreamTask.java:369)
	at org.apache.flink.runtime.taskmanager.Task$TaskCanceler.run(Task.java:1481)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
```
ping @yanghua

@twalthr I cherry-picked your refactor about FLINK-10624 and squashed them so that I can process this issue in parallel. But I split it into a single commit. But in essence, it is still blocked by FLINK-10624.
@twalthr This PR also blocked by FLINK-10624 which contains Kafka server version (2.0.0).
I have applied final changes and merged this. Thanks @yanghua for the contribution.

No, that's not sufficient. Even if we're saying that they are just counts, then adding them up still doesn't make sense either, or rather is quite questionable.
For example, if you had a run with parallelism=2, then both sources would emit 1, 2, 3, ... ,X and 1, 2, 3, ... ,Y respectively, but when you restore with parallelism=1 the source would continue from X + Y. I have a very hard time figuring out a use-case where this makes sense.

I'm closing this PR since changing this example (if we really decide to do it) goes beyond the scope of a hotfix.
The test failure is likely just an instability in the kafka test, feel free to ignore it for now.
The issue was resolved in jira ticket. Closing this PR.

@pnowojski Yes, I found some testing problems, this PR is not ready yet, so I didn't ping you more. Some of the issues you mentioned, I have found out, but not only that, I found that the shell method of sending and reading Kafka messages is not compatible with higher Kafka versions (parameters). I haven't had time to fix it yet, I will ping you when I am ready.
Sorry @hequn8128 that you have to wait that long and I remember about this PR, but I was busy with 1.7 release. I hopefully will be able to get back to this one in the next couple of days.
cc @pnowojski
cc @pnowojski

Ok, let me know once that is ready. Keep in mind that if it is not easy to fix, we can live without `0.9` e2e test.

Also if the fix for `0.9` would complicate `0.10+` tests I would also be in favour of dropping this, since we are considering to deprecate older connectors.

Hi @kingbase, thank you for your contribution. For the future please remember to create corresponding JIRA ticket or at lease add proper tags (in this case the best option would be to add `[hotfix]` tag.

Merging.

The failure occurs in the part of `tests` , details :


```
Results :

Failed tests: 
  TypeSerializerSnapshotMigrationITCase.testSavepoint:136->SavepointMigrationTestBase.restoreAndExecute:217 Values should be different. Actual: FAILED

Tests run: 1464, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 29
```

In addition, the part of `connectors` and `misc`  are both successful.
@pnowojski upgraded version of Kafka in file `flink-end-to-end-tests/flink-sql-client-test/pom.xml`

Hi @Clarkkkkk thanks for your contribution, I think there is some ongoing effort in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-6756 to solve it, that I think is a bit closer to the desired design. Could you coordinate your efforts in the jira?
CC @tzulitai @yanghua

Thanks for the update @dawidwys. I did a full pass through the document again and corrected a lot of minor things and some bugs. I propose to cherry-pick my changes on top of this PR. Such that other contributors can have the chance for a final pass.
You can find my changes here: https://github.com/twalthr/flink/tree/FLINK-10625

It looks unrelated and it's already reported: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-10895

Every time you see a test instability please check if there is already a JIRA ticket for it. If there is, add another comment "another instance: http://link.to.the.travis.log". If there is no existing jira ticket create a new one with attached log file.
